Is it possible to use the `decoderawtransaction` method with the Verus CLI without specifying a username?

Yes, it is possible to use the `decoderawtransaction` method with the Verus CLI without specifying a username. The example provided shows that when using the CLI, you can simply run `verus decoderawtransaction "hexstring"` without providing a username. However, when using the JSON-RPC API with `curl`, you do need to specify a username, as shown in the example: `curl --user myusername ...`.

Examples:
> verus decoderawtransaction "hexstring"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "decoderawtransaction", "params": ["hexstring"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
